field.name: description
field.value:
Since the last refactoring, the controller gets and sets it's state on Process() since a wizardPage is inherently a controller, then it depends on Process to have access to session/request/helpers etc., all being setup from the given IEngCtx and ICtrCtx on Process(). Therefore, IsPreConditionSatisfied can't use any of these, and it's a shame, as it has it's teeth pulled out (can't redirect using UrlHelper, can't check if some session var is present as a step prerequisite, etc.)
my proposed patch (sorry, Im on airport day so it's not at my hand right now): option a: 1. add Contextualize(engCtx, ctrCtx) to IController, and change Process(...) to Process() 2. change any call to Proces(...) to a call for Contextualize(..);Process() 3. call Contextualize before calling IsPreCond..() on the wizardActionProvider
pro: more flexible con: adding (not a lot but yet some) complexity to IController
option b: 1. add isContextualized to Controller, 2. add protected Contextualize(...) to Controller 3. add public Contextualize method to the base WizardPage only through IWizPage ,
pros: tests would not change, new-stuff is only on wizard-related code cons: none, but me thinking the Contextualize is appropriate on IController anyway
thoughts?
